rubric.number: Advantages and Disadvantages of The ADDIE Model
rubric.content:
While ADDIE has successfully helped guide thousands of ID projects, you should be aware that it has both advantages and disadvantages.

Click Advantages, Disadvantages, and then the link to learn more.

main:
{{[0]
}}
@@[0]
  • Ensures that goals, instruction, and evaluation all work together
  • Facilitates management of project
  • Provides opportunities for all project stakeholders to have input
@@
{{[1]
}}
@@[1]
  • Works best with large and complex projects
  • Has limited applicability when learning goals cannot be identified in advance (e.g. because the project involves more than training)
  • Might be too slow for many eLearning projects
@@

{{[2]
Click to learn more.
}}
@@[2]As more and more courses are deployed via the Internet, rapid development and other ID models, such as AGILE (Align, Get set, Iterate and Implement, Leverage and Evaluate) and SAM (Successive Approximation Model), are increasingly being used, in an effort to shorten development times. Nonetheless, ADDIE remains an important model that every instructional designer should know.@@
